meanings.definition: A list of people or things that are disapproved of or are to be punished or avoided.
meanings.sent1: The company keeps a blacklist of employees who have broken the rules.
meanings.sent2: She found her name on the blacklist and was not allowed to enter the building.
meanings.sent3: The blacklist at the library only includes books that are damaged beyond repair.
meanings.sent4: Being on the blacklist felt like wearing a scarlet letter for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The blacklist served as a warning to others to follow the rules carefully.

meanings.definition: To put someone on a blacklist.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to blacklist the troublemaker from future events.
meanings.sent2: They threatened to blacklist anyone who leaked confidential information.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would blacklist his friend from game night if he kept winning.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to blacklist negative thoughts to stay positive.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to blacklist distractions to focus on grading papers.

meanings.definition: To exclude someone from a group or activity.
meanings.sent1: The team captain decided to blacklist the player who kept causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: They had to blacklist him from the party after he started a fight.
meanings.sent3: She threatened to blacklist her brother from movie night if he didn't stop talking.
meanings.sent4: He had to blacklist unhealthy foods from his diet to improve his health.
meanings.sent5: The committee had to blacklist unreliable members to ensure smooth operations.
